page.title: 14Fire Guts Mill
page.content: "A fire which started on Sunday 12th May did an estimated Â£1 million worth of dammage.It took about 120 firemen from all over West Yorkshire to put out the fire at the mill.The mill was 120 years of age and used for storing aircraft components and owned by William Holden.The firemen used 20 pieces of equipment to control the fire which was well a blaze at most times.Hundreds of people stopped to have a look at the blazing inferno and people were evacuated from near by houses incase there was a danger of the fire spreading.The fire chief said that there was magnesium inside the building .It collided with the water causing explosions inside the building.Fortunately there were no injuries or lives lost in the fire."
